summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding an upcoming meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, required by a settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation. The email discusses coordinating with the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) to update the victim list and arrange for FBI presence, while aiming to avoid substantive discussions of victims' experiences during the main meeting.

persons.name: IMIIM
persons.context: Appears to be the author of this internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating victim meeting logistics.

persons.name: IMIIN
persons.context: Appears to be a recipient of this internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: ODAG Victim Meeting in DC
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) is setting up a meeting with victims in Washington, D.C., as required by the Department's settlement in the CVRA litigation, to explain and review the findings of OPR's investigation.

events.title: Nolle Proceeding
events.description: A 'nolle' proceeding occurred last August, after which a victim list was sent to ODAG.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Department of Justice is required to hold a meeting with Epstein victims as part of a settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation.
The purpose of the meeting is to explain and review the findings of the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigation.
Prosecutors are taking steps to minimize the likelihood of substantive victim interactions or statements during the main meeting, instead offering private meetings with FBI agents.
An attached Excel file named 'SDNY 2019.08.22 JE Victim List.rc.xlsx' contains a list of victims that was sent after a 'nolle' proceeding in August 2019.
The FBI victim services coordinator is mentioned as a potential contact for updating the victim list.
